name: 101 Dalmatians
text: Can you spot the difference?

name: 3D Maze
text: You are in a maze of twisty passages, all alike. Exits are to the north, south, east, and west.

name: 3D Tunnels
text: Let's take this to another dimension.

name: aa
text: aaaaaaaaa.

name: Accumulation
text: It looks like somebody ate a paintbox and then threw it up all over a module...

name: Adjacent Letters
text: UP, down, left, right, UP, down, left, right...!

name: Adventure Game
text: This appears to be a strange interface for an old text adventure game. All of the inventory management puzzles you have come to know and love, but none of the story.

name: Air Traffic Controller
text: Someone must be awfully upset with delays during your shift, maybe that's why there's a bomb on your desk.

name: Alchemy
text: Turning lead into gold? I wish I could turn this bomb into gold so I wouldn’t have to defuse it!

name: Algebra
text: "Why do we need to study algebra? We'll never use it in real life..." Anybody else remember saying that?

name: Alpha
text: AAAAAAAAAA... is what you'll be saying when this thing activates AGAIN.

name: Alphabet
text: Can you speak English? Do you know the alphabet? Then you should be okay.

name: Alphabetical Order
text: abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz

name: Alphabet Numbers
text: ...one, two, three, four... hang on... four, three, two... no... four, one, two...

name: Anagrams
text: Randomly punching in the letters will eventually give me another word. One of the arrangements must work, right?

name: Arithmelogic
text: (Math is fun) ^ (Bomb is armed) = True.

name: Answering Questions
text: I hope you studied, it's quiz night!

name: Baba Is Who?
text: Hey, I've heard of this game.

name: Astrology
text: Sometimes, the stars have it out for you. Is this bomb a good or a poor omen?

name: Backgrounds
text: For once you aren't only focusing on what's right in front of you. Make sure you pay attention to what's going on behind the scenes here. We all know how you feel about exploding.

name: Bartending
text: Time to mix drinks and save lives.

name: Bases
text: What's on second.

name: Battleship
text: FIRE! ... (splash) Missed.

name: Benedict Cumberbatch
text: More like Bouncystick Crapplepatch...

name: Big Circle
text: Who said that a circle was pointless?

name: Binary LEDs
text: Binary is a time-honored tradition of communication with tiny blinking lights.

name: Binary Puzzle
text: There are 10 types of people in the world. Those who can solve this puzzle, and those who have no idea what I'm talking about.

name: Binary Tree
text: Contrary to normal trees, binary trees grow downward and are endlessly confusing with their different traversal orderings...

name: Bitmaps
text: Over 18 quintillion combinations, only some of them actually matter.

name: Bitwise Operations
text: Nobody's favorite kind of math. Who even likes math, anyway?

name: Black Hole
text: Ground control to Major Tom, do you read?

name: Blackjack
text: I should start a Casino one day...

name: Blind Alley
text: What? Where?

name: Blind Maze
text: Not only do you have to find the exit, you have to find the beginning!

name: Blockbusters
text: "Can I have a 'P' please (Lit) BOB?"

name: Boggle
text: Find the words.

name: Boolean Maze
text: Punished by the wrath of Nor

name: Boolean Venn Diagram
text: Why is there a big Venn diagram? Why are there some weird symbols? Oh no...

name: Braille
text: This doesn't feel right.

name: British Slang
text: Good day dear sir. I'm absolutely spiffing today. Care for a spot of luncheon once finished with this thingamabob here?

name: Broken Buttons
text: How did they get invisible ink to even work like that?

name: Broken Guitar Chords
text: You hum it, I'll play it. On a guitar with a broken string!

name: Brush Strokes
text: Who thought it was a good idea to do brush strokes without a brush? Not to mention on a bomb too...

name: The Bulb
text: How many bomb defusal experts does it take to screw in a light bulb?

name: Burger Alarm
text: The last thing you'd want in your Burger King burger is somebody's time bomb, but as it turns out, that might be what you get.

name: Burglar Alarm
text: Why would you want to rob a bomb?

name: The Button
text: You might think that a button telling you to press it is pretty straightforward. That's the kind of thinking that gets people exploded.

name: Button Masher
text: Just don't break the button, speed runners should know how it feels.

name: Button Sequence
text: Click. Click. Kaboom!

name: Caesar Cipher
text: Communication was dangerous back in the days. Can you figure out what the original message was?

name: Calendar
text: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas... or is it Kwanzaa...? Day of the Dead?

name: Capacitor Discharge
text: I'm going to guess that this is just meant to occupy your attention, because otherwise this is some shoddy electronics work.

name: Catchphrase
text: Just say what you see.

name: Challenge & Contact
text: Why do we keep making modules based on games? Bomb defusal is supposed to be stressful, not fun...

name: Character Shift
text: haha what is shape shift?

name: Cheap Checkout
text: Who in the world is purchasing something at a time like this?

name: Chess
text: Under pressure, chess can feel more like a game of battleships.

name: Chord Qualities
text: They say that anything goes in jazz, but I didn't know that that includes long boring tables!

name: Christmas Presents
text: Looks like Cousin Bob has been gift-wrapping laundry detergent again...

name: The Clock
text: Tick-tock... as if you needed more reminding that time is running out.

name: The Code
text: What kind of code? It could be a letter code! It could be a digit code! Heck, it could even be an alphanumeric code! ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff.

name: Coffeebucks
text: These millennials make some weird caffeinated combinations. On the plus side, this company pays its taxes...

name: Color Decoding
text: The colors, Simon; what do they mean!?

name: Colored Keys
text: Who painted this keypad?

name: Colored Keys
text: Who painted this keypad?

name: Colored Squares
text: There is order in chaos. A pattern in the colors. Find it, and all will become clear.

name: Colored Switches
text: It's only five switches. How hard can it be?

name: Color Flash
text: It's easy to identify colors. Red, Blue, Green, etc. Turns out it's a bit harder when you display a word color in a different color though...

name: Colorful Insanity
text: The madness can be even worse.

name: Colorful Madness
text: I hope you don't have chromophobia!

name: Color Generator
text: While I wait for you to input, I'll just make myself a sandwich.

name: Color Match
text: Red! Green! Oh wait, I'm colorblind...

name: Color Math
text: So many colors!

name: Colour Code
text: Codes are used for locks! Why not colours?

name: Combination Lock
text: This looks like a combination lock. I thought I was disarming this bomb, not unlocking it.

name: Command Prompt
text: Who thought that installing some old Vista technology on a bomb was a good idea...

name: Complex Keypad
text: As if having four buttons wasn't enough.

name: Complicated Buttons
text: These buttons aren't like the others. The good news is that we've found a concise set of instructions on what to do about it! Maybe too concise...

name: Complicated Wires
text: These wires aren't like the others. Some have stripes! That makes them completely different. The good news is that we've found a concise set of instructions on what to do about it! Maybe too concise...

name: Connection Check
text: What is this, some kind of circuit visualization? I don't even care anymore...

name: Connection Device
text: And before you ask, no. You can't play video games on this device...

name: Cookie Jars
text: The cookies in this module are practically identical to real cookies, but if you dunk these ones in milk, you'll explode.

name: Cooking
text: The cake is a lie...

name: Coordinates
text: Column first or row first?

name: Countdown
text: And here's the Countdown clock...

name: Crackbox
text: Tetris?... Again?!

name: Crazy Talk
text: Nothing. Literally nothing. Blank. Nada.

name: Creation
text: Let there be life!

name: Cruel Countdown
text: And here's the Countdown clock...

name: Cruel Piano Keys
text: The devil's interval approaches...

name: Cryptography
text: WLMY ETGXFD EQCD ED PQKW WT CMFF EZYDFB.

name: The Crystal Maze
text: Will you start the fans, please!

name: The Cube
text: The mothership has been contacted. They've sent an executive toy...

name: Curriculum
text: I want to major in anything that takes this combination of classes together.

name: Cursed Double-Oh
text: I swear it didn't look like this last time I saw it.

name: Decolored Squares
text: A structure cannot stand without a foundation. Logic is the foundation of function. Function is the essence of control.

name: Determinants
text: What even is a determinant? Something from linear algebra? The Algebra II section on matrices didn't explain well.

name: DetoNATO
text: The word on the screen is: Alpha Lima Foxtrot Alpha.

name: The Digit
text: Only one number? Easy!

name: Digital Cipher
text: Let's digitize everything...

name: Digital Root
text: Okay, root of 64? - 8. No, the other kind of root. 4 then! NO, THE OTHER KIND!

name: Digit String
text: Terror has arrived in town, for some of your digits... are actually a sign!!

name: Discolored Squares
text: Order gives way to entropy. Entropy is the disappearance of order. Welcome... to the real chaos.

name: Divided Squares
text: Did the fact that this module's flavour text is in the middle of the page just jump out at you?

name: Dominoes
text: There's the two types of ways to use 'em, as a game or as an open sandbox.

name: Double Color
text: Introduce yourself to a non-vanilla mechanic on an easier module.

name: Double-Oh
text: (A module, please. Shaken, not stirred.) Stupid piece of junk; broken display, broken buttons...

name: Dragon Energy
text: "Initializing Language Package... Error!"

name: Draw
text: It’s the Wild Wild West!

name: Dr. Doctor
text: *coughs* Since when can a bomb give me a prescription?!?

name: Edgework
text: You would think that the ports on the side of the bomb are used for something other than just for answering questions...

name: Elder Futhark
text: "Fehu, Uruz, Teiwaz, Hagalaz, Ansuz, Raido, Kenaz"

name: Emoji Math
text: Math is easy. But is it easy when the numbers are in another language? Let's find out.

name: Encrypted Morse
text: Oh nice, a Morse module! Wait, what does HNWLIREAKHI mean?

name: English Test
text: You've lived all your life writing however you wanted without giving a second thought to who would be reading what you misspelled. But now, your life depends on your grammar and orthography, and this bomb is very nitpicky. You should of paid more attention in you're English class. ...Oh, carp.

name: Equations
text: sqrt(-1) 2^3 sum pi

name: Equations X
text: You have either tried to escape them, or you need to use them every single day... Whatever the case they are here now!

name: Error Codes
text: All of a sudden "Blue Screen of Death" takes on a whole new meaning.

name: European Travel
text: All aboard!

name: Extended Password
text: AAAAAA. No? AAAAAC. Wait, did we do "AAAAAB"? *sigh* AAAAAA...

name: Factory Maze
text: We should probably fix Double-Oh and Faulty Backgrounds, but we've spent our whole budget on doors.

name: Fast Math
text: Gotta go fast!

name: Faulty Backgrounds
text: I don't know if this counts as faulty... or just plain mean.

name: Faulty Sink
text: There's nothing worse than when your plumbing is not working properly.

name: The Festive Jukebox
text: What goes ho-ho-ho-BOOM?

name: Festive Piano Keys
text: Let's all gather round for a family sing-a-long!

name: The Fidget Spinner
text: I guarantee it's better than to pay respect.

name: Filibuster
text: What's this game called? Ok, let's do that.

name: FizzBuzz
text: Why put a classic schoolyard game on a bomb? Wait... that's odd...

name: Flags
text: I hope you're good at geography as this is a flag quiz that doesn't make any sense!

name: Flashing Lights
text: Morse code doesn't have 12 dots. I've no idea what it says...

name: Flavor Text
text: You have been made useful.

name: Flavor Text EX
text: You tasted its flavor. The real challenge begins.

name: Flip The Coin
text: Call it! Quickly, before the bomb does.

name: Follow the Leader
text: Child's play. Just follow the leader. Only if you fail to follow, the penalty is somewhat more explosive.

name: Font Select
text: Until now, you've only had to deal with the font Special Elite and whatever font that appears in the module, and usually it wasn't important, That changes today.

name: Foreign Exchange Rates
text: If bombs were stock brokers...

name: Forget Everything
text: I'm not sure what this is, and at this point I'm too afraid to ask.

name: Forget Me Not
text: This one likes attention, but not too much attention.

name: Forget This
text: Remembering one digit and not ten makes it ten times easier!

name: Four-Card Monte
text: A game of luck when defusing bombs, except if you can cheat luck.

name: Free Parking
text: For the record, I agree with Bob...

name: Friendship
text: Hey. I could defuse this bomb in ten seconds flat.

name: Functions
text: How in the heck do you get 8 from 1 and 3?!

name: Gadgetron Vendor
text: "Hi there fuzzball!"

name: Game of Life Simple
text: Solving this module is a matter of life and death!

name: Game of Life Cruel
text: Live a colorful life, they say. They're wrong. Colors just make life cruel.

name: The Gamepad
text: Oh, the layout of the buttons on this thing takes me back to my childhood! Except I didn't expect to see that on a time bomb, even. Play time is over, I suppose.

name: Genetic Sequence
text: Only true scientists synthetize proteins while bomb defusing.

name: The Giant's Drink
text: "He never guessed right. Sometimes his head was dissolved. Sometimes he caught on fire. Sometimes he fell in and drowned. Sometimes he fell out, turned green, and rotted away. It was always ghastly, and the Giant always laughed."

name: Graffiti Numbers
text: The answer to this puzzle is spray painted on the wall. Hurry up and punch it in!

name: Graphic Memory
text: It's only colors and shapes... How hard can it be?

name: Greek Calculus
text: The bomb makers are clever. Either the bomb explodes, or they get the answers to their calculus problems. Make your choice. Also, they like Greek letters. Good luck!

name: Gridlock
text: Even a traffic jam isn't this stop and go.

name: Grid Matching
text: Can you make the lights overlap in time?

name: Grocery Store
text: I hate going to the grocery store, it is so boring!

name: Gyphons
text: Gryphons are majestic, powerful, and cuddly. This one has an explosive taste in fashion.

name: Guitar Chords
text: You hum it, I'll play it.

name: The Hangover
text: Shhhhhhhh...

name: Harmony Sequence
text: A harmony is to the musician's ears as a steak is to the gourmet.

name: The Hexabutton
text: More buttons. More buttons.

name: Hexamaze
text: Dammit Jim, I'm a doctor, not a honeybee!

name: Hex To Decimal
text: Be happy you are only doing this for one game session. At least you weren't Nintendo in the 1980's figuring out how to program the NES with 0's and 1's.

name: Hidden Colors
text: Some things are just hidden in plain sight.

name: Hieroglyphics
text: Desecrate this module at your own risk. Death will come on swift wings to whomsoever fails to disarm it...

name: Hogwarts
text: Alohomora! ... Hm, why doesn't that solve the module?

name: Homophones
text: English is a stupid language.

name: Horrible Memory
text: I thought Memory only went up to 4? Geez, I can't remember anything these days...

name: Hot Potato
text: Hot potato, hot potato.

name: HTTP Response
text: When your bomb acts as a web server...

name: Human Resources
text: Just like management... ignore the problem about to blow up, and care more about the small details like personnel.

name: Hunting
text: Are you the hunter? Or are you the hunted?

name: The Hypercube
text: This device looks like it was recovered from an alien spacecraft. It moves in strange ways. What does it want from us?

name: Ice Cream
text: Simon screams for ice cream!

name: Identity Parade
text: Time to turn detective; there's a criminal on the loose.

name: IKEA
text: I came in for a table, and left with a lamp, a mattress, and a bomb...

name: Instructions
text: I mean, if there wasn't instructions here, we'd have a big problem.

name: The iPhone
text: Somebody has welded a smart phone onto a bomb. Nobody tell Apple - it's probably a crime in certain states.

name: The Jack-O’-Lantern
text: Trick or treat!

name: The Jewel Vault
text: How did the Ancient Greeks make such an advanced lock? It must be aliens!

name: The Jukebox
text: P-A-R-T-Why? Because if you don't, we're going to explode.

name: Keypad
text: I'm not sure what these symbols are, but I suspect they have something to do with occult.

name: Knob
text: Needlessly complicated and endlessly needy. Imagine if such expertise were used to make something other than diabolical puzzles.

name: Know Your Way
text: If DOWN is on the LEFT I have to press RIGHT if I wanna submit UP. Easy.

name: Krazy Talk
text: "Quote, it says 'It says, start: "It says: Quote... 'Quote, end quote.' Fullstop." End quote'. End quote."

name: Kudosudoku
text: Roses are red, violets are blue; but the hard part here is not the Sudoku.

name: The Labyrinth
text: It's like a maze, only spelt differently.

name: Lasers
text: Don't shoot yourself in the foot.

name: Laundry
text: Sorting and folding are the least of your worries.

name: LED Encryption
text: Ooooh, shiny lights and buttons. Touchy touchy!

name: LED Grid
text: Maybe they were Christmas lights in a previous life?

name: LED Math
text: No, this isn't Color Morse.

name: Left and Right
text: Right is there where the thumb is left...

name: LEGOs
text: Make sure to not step on this module! Not only will the bomb explode, but your foot will really hurt.

name: Letter Keys
text: I haven't thought of anything yet...

name: Light Cycle
text: The name "blinkenlights" was taken.

name: Lights Out
text: Who knew turning out all the lights was a hard task?

name: Lightspeed
text: "Mr La Forge, set phasers to explode..."

name: Lion's Share
text: Or: the shallow end of the gene pool.

name: Listening
text: "Why did we send a deaf person to defuse a bomb?" - Person who is no longer alive.

name: Logic
text: Logic is easy, but logic AND bomb defusal might not.

name: Logical Buttons
text: It has logical in the name, so if it doesn't make sense to you that's your fault.

name: Logic Gates
text: There are only 10 types of bomb experts: those who understand logic gates, and those who don't.

name: Lombax Cubes
text: I don't think a wrench will fix this one...

name: The London Underground
text: Mind the gap!

name: Mad Memory
text: Bonus points to any team who can disarm this without writing everything down.

name: Mafia
text: Godfather is him, Mafia is her, kill them, save them. I'm innocent! ....AHHHHH!

name: Mahjong
text: Plum, Orchid, Chrysanthemum, Bamboo. Remember that.

name: Maintenance
text: How to repair your car. Step 1: Call a mechanic. There is no step 2...

name: Manometers
text: A story of pressure ...

name: Marble Tumble
text: Left. Left! ... No, the other left!

name: Maritime Flags
text: When radio communication fails, signal flags may be the answer.

name: Mashematics
text: Let's see here, 96 + 3 = 99. Oh god.

name: Mastermind Simple
text: The classic code-breaking game, with a twist. Can you remember everything?

name: Mastermind Cruel
text: The game from your childhood. Only advanced. And harder to memorize. And the feedback isn't what it used to be...

name: Math
text: Math is still easy. But is it easy when you have to answer questions over and over to stop an explosion? Only one way to find out.

name: Maze
text: This seems to be some kind of maze, probably stolen off of a restaurant placemat.

name: Maze^3
text: It’s like the original, but on a whole ’nother scale!

name: Mazematics
text: Wax lyrical about mazes mathematical.

name: Maze Scrambler
text: So pressing up several times will move you in literally every direction but up, that's almost as bad as 7 being the bottom left in a module with numbered buttons that are in a random order.

name: Mega Man 2
text: In the year 200X, a super robot named Mega Man was created. Dr. Light created Mega Man to stop the evil desires of Dr. Wily. However, after his defeat, Dr. Wily created eight of his own robots to counter Mega Man.

name: Melody Sequencer
text: Harmony and melody... creating both is the musician's greatest feat.

name: Memory
text: Memory is a fragile thing but so is everything else when a bomb goes off, so pay attention!

name: Microcontroller
text: It's called "micro"-controller, yet this thing in there is pretty big. Probably because it can cause a pretty big explosion...

name: Micro-Modules
text: Does this bomb look smaller to you? Wait... Why is it mounted on a bigger bomb?

name: Mineseeker
text: Everything you need is right in front of you... and in this manual of course.

name: Minesweeper
text: Somehow Minesweeper on a bomb feels oddly redundant.

name: Modern Cipher
text: The Roman warlord Caesar had his own personal way to encrypt his data. We could think about him as the father of the modern cryptography. But you are a qualified soldier so you won't have problems in decoding our message, don't you?

name: Module Homework
text: Yess! Homework! School is so easy that this'll be over in no ti- Wait... What subject is this?

name: Module Maze
text: This seems to be some kind of maze, probably stolen off a restaurant placemat in a world dominated by crazy bomb-making robots.

name: Modules Against Humanity
text: Some of these modules are really inhumane. What should you do then? Just laugh in their faces.

name: Modulo
text: For those wanting a crash course on the modulo operation, fill yer boots!

name: Monsplode, Fight!
text: Are you still a fan of some animated series from your childhood? It looks like you stumbled upon another fan.

name: Monsplode Trading Cards
text: A Bob in the hand is worth two in... the Buhar?

name: The Moon
text: Brrr, it's very cold here on the dark side. Who turned off the Sun?

name: Morse-A-Maze
text: It is AMazing that the status light got a life of its own.

name: Morse Buttons
text: Oh, yes... More buttons and blinking lights... How original...

name: Morse Code
text: An antiquated form of naval communication? What next? At least it's genuine Morse Code, so pay attention and you might just learn something.

name: Morsematics
text: Get it? Because it uses morse and maths! I'll see myself out...

name: Morse War
text: Whether you are sending supplies to foreign allies, or submarines for assault, lives are in your hands.

name: Mortal Kombat
text: Test your might!

name: Motion Sense
text: Don't move. Its explosiveness is based on movement.

name: Mouse In The Maze
text: Inside some bombs is a mouse that is remote-controlled via a chip in its spinal cord.

name: Murder
text: This module is powered by the restless soul of a murder victim. The only way to disarm it is to solve the case so the victim can pass peacefully to the afterlife.

name: Mystic Square
text: O knight in shining armour, deliver us from the evils of the skull!

name: The Necronomicon
text: Ph’nglui mglw’nafh Cthulhu R’lyeh wgah’nagl fhtagn.

name: Needy Mrs Bob
text: "What do you mean, 'I never listen to you'? Wait, which button again?"

name: Neutralization
text: The rules are simple: neutralize or be neutralized.

name: Nonogram
text: Who in the world puts a newspaper puzzle on an explosive device?

name: The Number
text: Quick, press random buttons and hope for the best!

name: The Number Cipher
text: Nobody is quite sure why this thing resets every few seconds. It's probably for health and safety reasons.

name: Number Nimbleness
text: How long can such a task really take?

name: Number Pad
text: Try putting in 0000. No? Try 0001. Still not working? We might be here for a while...

name: Numbers
text: 420-69 are my favorite numbers.

name: Odd One Out
text: One of these things is not like the others! One of these things just doesn’t belong!

name: Only Connect
text: Greek letters are too pretentious, so we use Egyptian hieroglyphs.

name: Orientation Cube
text: If the bomb doesn't kill us a brain haemorrhage will.

name: Painting
text: "I really believe that if you practice enough you could paint the 'Mona Lisa' with a two-inch brush."

name: Party Time
text: This party is the bomb!

name: Passport Control
text: Congratulations. The October Labor Lottery is complete. Your name was pulled. Glory to Arstotzka, glory greatest country!

name: Password
text: Fortunately this password doesn't seem to meet standard government security requirements: 22 characters, mixed case, numbers in random order without any palindromes above length 3.

name: Pattern Cube
text: Do I get any hint coins? Come on, it's the Dropstone 50th Anniversary!

name: Pay Respects
text: Press F to pay respects. Unless you're EA, then it's "press F to pay".

name: Periodic Table
text: What do you do with a sick defuser? If you can't helium, and you can't curium, then you might as well barium.

name: Perplexing Wires
text: Complicated Wires just isn't complicated enough.

name: Perspective Pegs
text: Everything is different from the perspective of another.

name: Piano Keys
text: What do you get when you drop a piano down a mine shaft? A flat minor.

name: Pie
text: What is the point of naming this module 'pie' if there is no pie?! The pie is a lie!

name: Pigpen Rotations
text: Is that alien language or what?

name: Planets
text: Why do people do this... The Milky Way shouldn't be on a bomb!

name: Playfair Cipher
text: Encrypting secrets since 1854, exploding bombs since 2018.

name: Plumbing
text: I'd wash your hands after this one...

name: The Plunger
text: Houston, we have an easy needy module.

name: The Plunger Button
text: A big square button saying "PUSH ME!"? What could possibly go wrong?

name: Poetry
text: Will you write your way into her heart?

name: Point of Order
text: We are playing weird 4-card KTANE Mao. Play begins with me and proceeds in a clockwise direction.

name: Poker
text: Usually in poker, the wrong call means losing a lot of money. Here, it means death.

name: Polyhedral Maze
text: What's a pentecostal hexadecimal contradiction?

name: Press X
text: Due to the fact that gamepads and controllers exist, we unfortunately had to settle with "Press 'X'".

name: Probing
text: Not that kind of probing...

name: Purgatory
text: Imagine if you died while disarming a purgatory module, hehe... I'm going to hell for that one.

name: QR Code
text: Yes, you will need a QR Code scanner here to proceed.

name: Question Mark
text: Look, someone made the lucky block from Minecraft into a module!

name: Quintuples
text: "Quintuple" has its roots in the Latin for five. There are lots of fives to think about here.

name: Quiz Buzz
text: How do you make FizzBuzz even more exciting? Add in Tom Scott and trivia. And explosions.

name: Radiator
text: Is it me or is it getting hot in here?

name: The Radio
text: The signal keeps breaking up...

name: Random Number Generator
text: We are now at the mercy of RNGesus.

name: Rapid Buttons
text: This module really pushes my buttons. Then again, most are designed to.

name: Refill that Beer!
text: You don't want to end up getting drunk now, do ya?

name: Regular Crazy Talk
text: It says: You're breaking up. ... No, that's what it says. You're breaking u-- What?... You're breaking up with your girlfriend?!

name: Resistors
text: "It is easier to resist at the beginning than at the end." - Leonardo da Vinci, on procrastination

name: Retirement
text: Time to spend some time with your remaining limbs following far too many explosions.

name: Reverse Morse
text: It's one thing to read somebody else's Morse message. Now it's time to send your own.

name: Rhythms
text: Have you ever taken a music theory class where you had to count and clap rhythms? This is just like that, only here your suffering _ends_ when you get it wrong.

name: Rock-Paper-Scissors-L.-Sp.
text: Anecdotal evidence suggests that in the game of Rock-Paper-Scissors, players familiar with each other will tie 75 to 80% of the time due to the limited number of outcomes. Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock was created by Internet pioneer Sam Kass as an improvement on the classic game. All hail Sam Kass. Hail.

name: Roman Art
text: Otherwise known as giant marble buildings, people, or sometimes paintings.

name: Rotary Phone
text: Hello, this is emergency services, please hold...

name: Round Keypad
text: I think someone tried to make this module look really cool, but failed.

name: Rubik's Clock
text: Time is a relative concept. But it can absolutely turn you crazy.

name: Rubik's Cube
text: Remember this impossible thing? Now it's on a bomb. Have fun.

name: Safety Safe
text: This safe either contains immense riches, or is empty.

name: Schlag den Bomb
text: I'm not sure if this is easier or harder than adding hundred-digit numbers...

name: The Screw
text: You know what? Screw this module...

name: Scripting
text: As a scripter, I can say none of this makes sense.

name: Sea Shells
text: Clear communication is crucial when defusing bombs. One can only assume that this module doesn't want to be defused.

name: Semaphore
text: This module demands attention from the sea - unlucky for you the bomb's bone dry.

name: S.E.T.
text: Modules based on card games seem to be a thing now.

name: Seven Wires
text: You thought wires were easy?

name: Shape Memory
text: Oh look! It's that game that everyone knows of but nobody knows the name of!

name: Shapes And Bombs
text: I wonder what shape I would input today...

name: Shape Shift
text: The concept is simple: change a shape into another shape according to certain rules. The rules, however, are not so simple.

name: Shikaku
text: Get in shape without exercising!

name: Signals
text: Do you know what a camelback looks like?

name: Silly Slots
text: Sassy Sally said sorry since soggy Steven slurped soup.

name: Simon Samples
text: Definitely needs more cowbell.

name: Simon Says
text: This is like one of those toys you played with as a kid where you have to match the pattern that appears, except this one is a knockoff that was probably purchased at a dollar store.

name: Simon Scrambles
text: He got lost. Which colors did he show? He doesn't remember.

name: Simon Screams
text: He's angry! He's furious! He's enraged! He's had it!

name: Simon Sends
text: Did you expect this flavor text to refer to itself?

name: Simon Shrieks
text: I... I don't know if I want to do this anymore...

name: Simon Sings
text: Never gonna sing in tune, never gonna flash maroon, never gonna call up Simon and show up. Never gonna seal your fate, never gonna detonate, never gonna solve your modules and blow up.

name: Simon Sounds
text: He says, he shrieks, and now he sounds.

name: Simon Speaks
text: - Miten minun pitaisi tietaa, mita tama tarkoittaa? - Nem beszelek finnul! - Hvad?

name: Simon Spins
text: You're good as long as it's not your head that's spinning.

name: Simon Squawks
text: Meet Simon's needy second cousin. He's also called Simon.

name: Simon's Sequence
text: He got bored so he will endlessly bother you.

name: Simon's Stages
text: Simon's angsty teenage years; in monochrome and causing as much pain as possible...

name: Simon's Star
text: Simon has given up on doing stuff and started possessing stuff instead.

name: Simon States
text: I'm not sure this even qualifies as Simon Says...

name: Simon Stops
text: If you don't hear something, think quick, or you might be hearing something real loud real soon...

name: Sink
text: I'd say bombs have everything but the kitchen sink, but apparently they have that too.

name: Skewed Slots
text: This has to be illegal somehow...

name: Skinny Wires
text: Wires so skinny you could cut them with nail scissors.

name: Skyrim
text: Use the power of the Dovahkiin to disarm the module.

name: Snap!
text: There are only two numbers. This shouldn't be annoying, right?

name: Snooker
text: Who knew there was so much maths in snooker?

name: Sonic & Knuckles
text: Sonic the Hedgehog was a popular 16-bit video game from... Wait a minute; this isn't Sonic the Hedgehog. Are SEGA on commission or something?

name: Sonic the Hedgehog
text: Sonic the Hedgehog was a popular 16 bit video game from 1991. What it's doing here on a bomb over 25 years later is anybody's guess...

name: Souvenir
text: Something to remember your explosion by.

name: Speak English
text: So. Many. Languages.

name: The Sphere
text: And you thought The Cube was bad...

name: Spinning Buttons
text: You spin me right round baby, right round!

name: Splitting The Loot
text: Divvying up stolen loot is an explosive task.

name: Square Button
text: This may look like the button you know and love, but don't be fooled! It's a brilliantly disguised imposter foiled only by a single mistake: It's the wrong shape.

name: Stack’em
text: All these cubes, and I have to do what with them? Stack them? Where are they even coming from...

name: The Stare
text: I WARNED YOU ABOUT STARES BRO!!!! I TOLD YOU DOG!

name: The Stock Market
text: Wall Street isn't exactly new to high pressure situations, so what's a live bomb?

name: The Stopwatch
text: Patience is key!

name: Street Fighter
text: Hadouken!

name: Subscribe to Pewdiepie
text: Unsubscribe to T-Series >:(((((((

name: Subways
text: Why can't you find your own way...

name: Sueet Wall
text: This module is sueet.

name: The Sun
text: Is it hot in here or is it just me? No, seriously, is the air conditioning on at all?!

name: Superlogic
text: Make it so.

name: The Swan
text: Every 108 (minutes) seconds, the button must be pushed...

name: The Switch
text: This bomb is doing a major "Flip You," so why not flip it back?

name: Switches
text: A yes or no choice isn't too bad. Unfortunately you have to make five of them and any of them could be your last.

name: Symbol Cycle
text: Have you ever stared at the logo on the screensaver and hoped that it would bounce exactly into a corner?

name: Symbolic Coordinates
text: Those symbols are probably just a reference to where the mothership is docked, right?

name: Symbolic Password
text: Websites allow symbols in passwords now, but this is ridiculous!

name: SYNC-125 [3]
text: - Parallel universes? What's next? Time paradoxes? Non-euclidean spaces? *DING* - Oh god, you've just given someone an idea.

name: Synchronization
text: Bringing order to chaos, one blinking light at a time.

name: Synonyms
text: A thesaurus would really help here.

name: Tangrams
text: "A brand new concept for integrated circuit mass production, the ITC: Integrated Tangram Circuit (Patent Pending)."

name: Tap Code
text: Is this not Morse code?

name: Tasha Squeals
text: Why does Simon get to have all of the fun? Once Tasha starts squealing, everyone else is shocked!

name: Tax Returns
text: I'm not going to lie; now is probably not the best time to be getting on top of your paperwork...

name: Ten-Button Color Code
text: A "simple" module about "simple" colors, banking on the fact that you can follow its "simple" directions.

name: Tennis
text: Game, set, and match.

name: Terraria Quiz
text: If you're so concerned about blowing up, why didn't you just get adamantite reinforcements, duh!

name: Tetris
text: Chances are you've already played many iterations of this game. At this point, how can we be sure that Tetris isn't some kind of meta-virus that propagates itself through game developers and modders?

name: Text Field
text: It's trivial. Just 6 letters out there! Wait, what did you say? Each letter has 5 rules to check? Never mind then.

name: Third Base
text: This module is identical to Who's On First, except with four characters on each button instead of confusing words and phrases. This should be easy... right?

name: Tic-Tac-Toe
text: All those years of getting ties in Tic-Tac-Toe might finally pay off.

name: The Time Keeper
text: I just need a few more seconds, okay?

name: Timezone
text: Nobody likes to convert timezones.

name: The Triangle
text: Continuing with the shape theme, now in just two dimensions...

name: The Triangle Button
text: This may seem like acute module, but that's not right. In fact, such a presumption is quite obtuse.

name: The Troll
text: They see me trolling. They hating.

name: Turn The Key
text: How can something so simple be so infuriating?

name: Turn The Keys
text: Order is everything.

name: Turtle Robot
text: It's a bit old and buggy, but it works.

name: Two Bits
text: This poorly programmed lookup device is as maddening with its slow responses as it is unforgiving with ill-timed inputs. Patience required.

name: T-Words
text: Troublesome terms to tell the trained team-member.

name: Uncolored Squares
text: A pattern is more than the sum of its parts. Find the parts, and let the pattern emerge.

name: Unfair Cipher
text: It doesn't play that fair anymore.

name: Unrelated Anagrams
text: By barking with text-to-speech on, the dog accidentally programmed a module.

name: USA Maze
text: The United States of America: where easy video games come from.

name: Valves
text: Um... Where do I blow the air?

name: Varicolored Squares
text: Conformity is key. Patterns encourage conformity. Find the pattern, and conformity will naturally arise.

name: Venting Gas
text: Computer hacking is hard work! Well, it usually is. This job could probably be performed by a simple drinking bird pressing the same key over and over again.

name: Vexillology
text: For every flag you make that does not exist, think of a new country name. Good waste of time while defusing a bomb.

name: Visual Impairment
text: Don't look at this manual too long, or you will actually go blind!

name: Waste Management
text: Fun fact - The amount of food wasted in Singapore is equivalent to every household throwing two bowls of rice away every day, per annum.

name: Wavetapping
text: Perhaps the craziest conference call I've ever heard. Don't hang up. DO NOT HANG UP.

name: Web Design
text: Welcome to web design class. The first rule of web design is: You do not talk about Comic Sans MS. The second rule is: You DO NOT talk about Comic Sans MS. The third rule is: The word "color" is NEVER spelled with a U.

name: Westeros
text: An explosion is coming...

name: Who's on First
text: This contraption is like something out of a sketch comedy routine, which might be funny if it wasn't connected to a bomb. I'll keep this brief, as words only complicate matters.

name: Who's That Monsplode
text: Are you still a fan of some animated series from your childhood? It looks like you stumbled upon another fan.

name: Wingdings
text: What in the world are these symbols and why are they on this bomb? Wait... are you telling me that's an actual font?!

name: The Wire
text: Only one wire? You should probably cut it. Wait, what do those dials do?

name: Wire Placement
text: Sometimes, the wire may look like a face, calming you down... and then you explode.

name: Wires
text: Wires are the lifeblood of electronics! Wait, no, electricity is the lifeblood. Wires are more like the arteries. The veins? No matter...

name: Wire Sequence
text: It's hard to say how this mechanism works. The engineering is pretty impressive, but there must have been an easier way to manage nine wires.

name: Wire Spaghetti
text: Looks like somebody's first attempt at wiring up a PCB. At least they tried...

name: The Witness
text: ...and a dream.

name: Word Scramble
text: These letters are confusing. I think they're in the wrong order.

name: Word Search
text: LZIEAJDHARDERBNCOJWTHANPQIEYBZITLOOKSYWH

name: X01
text: Precision and a steady hand are the keys to all bomb-related activities.

name: X-Ray
text: I can see right through you.

name: Yahtzee
text: When has bomb defusal ever been a game of chance?

name: Zoni
text: Remember, the universe has a wonderful sense of humour. The trick is, learning how to take a joke.

name: Zoo
text: Ruff! Roar! Meow! Warble! Neigh! Tweet! Mew! Cock-a-doodle-doo! Honk! Baa! Bark! Bellow! Crow! Cha-caw! Buzz! Growl! Ribbit! Coo! Caw! Gobble! Screech! Whinny! Bleat! Hee-haw! Chirrup! Arf! Croak! Chirp! Squawk! Woof! Bow-wow! Cluck! Snort! Yap! Click! Squeal! Oink! Hoot! Moo! Squeak! Howl! Bah-gawk! Purr! Hiss! Quack!
